snippet: District Attorney Daniel M. Donovan Jr. said he would have a panel investigate the death of Eric Garner, which the medical examiner’s office ruled a homicide.
abstract: Staten Island District Atty Daniel M Donovan Jr announces that he will open grand jury investigation into death of Eric Garner, unarmed black man who died after being restrained by New York City police officers; civil rights advocates have drawn a link between Garner incident and fatal shooting of unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo, and are pressing for prosecution of officers in both episodes.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: District Attorney Daniel M. Donovan Jr. said he would have a panel investigate the death of Eric Garner, which the medical examiner’s office ruled a homicide.

headline.main: Grand Jury to Take Up Death Linked to Police Chokehold in Staten Island
headline.print_headline: Grand Jury to Take Up Death Linked to Chokehold
